p: By using the GEPIA2 database [ 40], we demonstrated TMEM45B upregulation in all three iCluster PCs compared to prostate tissues, C1orf106 downregulation in iCluster 1 and iCluster 2 PCs compared to prostate tissues, NANS increase in iCluster 1 PCs, and SRD5A3 upregulation in iCluster 2 PCs compared to prostate tissues ( Figure 3A). PCs within iCluster 1 are featured with ETV1 and ETV4 fusion, SHOP mutations, FOXA1 mutations, and CHD1 deletion, but lack ERG fusion [ 5]. iCluster 2 PCs are enriched with ERG fusion and PTEN deletion [ 5]. iCluster 3 PCs contain ERG fusion [ 5]. TP53 hetero-deficiency and RB1 deletion occur more frequently in iCluster 1 and iCluster 2 PCs [ 5]. Advanced PCs (GS â‰¥ 8) are much more common in iCluster 1 and iCluster 2 compared to iCluster 3 [ 5], suggesting that PCs in iClusters 1 and 2 are more aggressive than those in iCluster 3. This concept indicates an association of the 10 LE genes with PC progression.
